intro: Touchardia oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu's touchardia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of the region. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
